page.title: 06The Doctor in Langford
page.content: The local doctor has his own practice and the only person that works with him is his wife.He took over the practice eighteen months ago.He has a surgery in Langford and also in some of the surrounding villages. The doctor sees about two hundred patients every week and about ten percent are children. He sees more people in the winter than at any other time during the year. He gets called out at night about three or four times a week. He sends approximately four patients a week to hospital.(The John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford).He visits patients at home everyday of the week. He usually works fourteen hours a day and is on call all the time. He rarely catches anything from his patients. He perscribes over two thousand different kinds of medicine every year.
